bow: any home birth experiences tell us your stories accidental home birth just really did think was in labour husband comes home from work is like what the holy heck you are in labour he calls 911 baby is born min later on our bathroom floor next time ll go to the hospital when the cramping starts not home birth we were at the birth center so also not the hospital it was magical truly ll probably try for home birth next time just wanted to say you may want to try on crunchymommit too also if you can splurge for the tub labored most of the time in the tub and we ended up there for the birth as well it was wonderful for me had two home births loved the 2nd one much more than the first make sure you get care provider that you trust and feel comfortable with the first time only had one choice and it was better than imagine the hospital would have been but still would label it as good let me know if you have any questions sure planned home birth water broke at 9pm called and informed midwife at 10 pm felt my first contraction called midwife back to let her know labor had begun at 10:15 my husband began filling the tub for me at 10:30 began feeling very shaking and lot of pain husband called midwife who said she was on her way and would be there shortly at 10:45 was crying and telling husband something was terribly wrong and he should tell the midwife think needed to go to the hospital at 11:00 the midwife had arrived and laughed at me for future reference never laugh at woman in labor was told to reach down between my legs did felt head at 11:05 my daughter was born midwife almost missed it husband did catch her due to trying to keep me from drowning myself in the tub 10 10 would do again homebirth loved my planned home birth my mother is nurse with special needs kids many of the kiddos she has taken care of are non verbal wheelchair bound and have slew of issues many of these same kids have one thing in common home births they would have been born normal if they had been born in hospital or in birthing center anywhere capable of detecting that the baby was in distress all for having natural birth even though it was in the cards for me but in controlled environment my baby is still in the nicu but he and are still here due to the incredible staff at my local hospital was just having conversation with one of the nicu nurses last week her sil was contemplating home birth but she talked her out if it she has seen the tragic results of home births gone wrong she told me they were the most heartbreaking as the babies did have to end up there my two children were both born intentionally at home it was really nice to be able to labor and then recover at home initially looked into it because knew it would increase my chances to be able to have natural intervention free birth experience both labors were relatively fast six hours for the first baby and three for the second will say that depending on where you live and who your provider is it makes the process of getting birth certificate and doing things like the newborn hearing screening or rhogam administration much more difficult where these things are not difficult to accomplish in the hospital if you have any specific questions be happy to do my best to answer nice anecdote but am not sure believe that most special needs children are home birthed had two home births one of which you can listen to here http thebirthhour com podcast brynhuntpalmer they were totally different experiences with my first was 16 days over and in labor 34 hours with my second was 12 days over but only in labor for in the podcast linked to tell my second birth story anywhere capable of detecting that the baby was in distress midwives are fully capable of detecting fetal distress they do use intermittent monitoring so it is possible to not catch it when it first starts but that will happen regardless or home or hospital status when using im please learn what actually goes on at home birth before spewing false information about them just has my first home birth on monday have had chance to type up my birth story yet but it was amazing and everything wanted my midwife doula team was awesome baby looked stellar at her first doctor appointment and she really loves her boobies not sure why you re being down voted statistically home births have fewer complications http www bbc co uk news health 30206540 obviously it not for everyone but plenty of people have them safely congratualtions that sounds amazing hopefully you ll post it here whenever you get around to typing it up glad to hear the baby doing so well how are your first few postpartum days going thank you planned on working on it today while my mom is here doing really well and have healed more quickly than my hospital birth but my labor was super fast this time around so bet that has lot to do with it this sounds very similar to my last birth just did realize how far and how fast everything was going he was born less than five minutes after we reached the emergency room as soon as we arrived told the dr wanted to walk around for minute and he laughed and said look down all could see was the baby headfull of dark curly hair was like *ok never mind* and moment later was holding him my cousin is midwife in training and she has told me that out of 10 births she attends are some form of water birth apparently lot of people love them was able to spend some time in the water during my second birth and it was wonderful thank you for the link will definately be listening she said many not most in britain yes the us has an entirely different system and ca be compared it not easy to find nurse midwife cnm who does homebirths here most of what you ll get are woefully under trained professional midwives cpm the us homebirth stats are not nearly so rosy thought about home birth glad did my daughter would have died she has rare genetic disease that was picked up on newborn screening few hours after she slipped into coma please please please if you decide to do home birth immediately head to the hospital to have newborn screening done if we had went forward with homebirth and peds few days later my daughter would be dead both my sons were born at home in an inflatable tub in our kitchen first one was an hour labor second was six hour labor for my second labor went from 2cm dilated to holding my baby with two hours it was intense was attended by the same awesome midwife both times love every aspect of having home births and if have third kid ll definitely do it the same way again thanks for sharing so sorry for the trauma you went through if you would be comfortable would you share the diagnosis for lack of better term so that may read about it sure it is glutaric aciduria type she has very severe form which normally kiddos do live past year thankfully the doctors have been surprised and we are approaching her 2nd bday she is physically disabled but mentally ok she is doing lot better than we thought we went home from the nicu on hospice and expected the worst we continue to live each day to its fullest unfortunately with the rise of home births there have been number of families that have lost babies because these disorders were caught on newborn screening fully support having the birth you want gave birth naturally in birth center that is located inside hospital but you never want to be in the position have seen other moms been in their baby death could have been prevented with spot of blood it is so tragic those statistics do account for the amount of women who give birth in hospitals because they are high risk and or need more medical intervention personally have met several of them know of many others ve seen the life long guilt that the mothers carry ve seen these kids trapped in bodies that do work some of these kids minds work just fine but they are trapped until someone figures out way to communicate for me personally it is not worth it spent months trying my best to grow health baby it was not nor will it every be worth it to me too risk that also just had this conversation with 20 year veteran of the nicu she continues to see the bad results can home birth be wonderful of course babies have been born at home for thousands of years however babies died women died would have died without modern medicine so yeah emotionally attached to this issue also do want anyone to go through the agony of losing child or having to see their baby who was healthy hours before birth struggle for life grateful for modern medicine that allowed both me and my son to survive sure there are qualified professionals out there not saying that it is possible but do know of two cases just this year where mothers that know personally were attempting home births and almost lost their babies one was due to someone who called herself midwife but let the mother get to the point where she gave up before calling for an ambulance both almost died the other baby heart stopped they called for an ambulance but it took an hour to get to hospital that could handle her that baby is showing signs of developmental delay unfortunately many mothers that know that choose home births are also very religious they also do believe in regular prenatal care they do trust science and medicine this also puts them at higher risk because many of them do catch issues that would have identified than as high risk so do know something not an expert but know that home birth was gamble was willing to make not with my life not with my baby of course home births can and do turn out fine the vast majority are safe and uncomplicated but do think that considering the real risks associated with home birth is also wise they do all turn out with happy healthy mother and baby also not all pregnancies are good candidates for home births without modern medicine and section both my baby and would be dead today planning home water year over year planned homebirth for low risk prospective mother avoids unnecessary but common risks of potentially harmful interventions the statistics are not definitive by any means there simply
